name: RadioGroup
description:
Provides a shared state to a series of radio buttons.
Renders a `<div>` element.

name.description: Identifies the field when a form is submitted.

defaultValue.description:
The uncontrolled value of the radio button that should be initially selected.

To render a controlled radio group, use the `value` prop instead.

value.description:
The controlled value of the radio item that should be currently selected.

To render an uncontrolled radio group, use the `defaultValue` prop instead.

onValueChange.description: Callback fired when the value changes.
onValueChange.detailedType:
| ((
    value: any,
    eventDetails: Radio.Group.ChangeEventDetails,
  ) => void)
| undefined

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

readOnly.description: Whether the user should be unable to select a different radio button in the group.

required.description: Whether the user must choose a value before submitting a form.

inputRef.description: A ref to access the hidden input element.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: RadioGroup.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-disabled.description: Present when the radio group is disabled.
